item.title: We just got a hint that we might have to pay more for the iPhone 17 - TechRadar
item.description:
We just got a hint that we might have to pay more for the iPhone 17

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: TechRadar

  • iPhone 17 price increases are expected
  • As yet we haven't seen many price leaks
  • A new model is expected to appear in 2025

It’s anticipated that the iPhone 17 will be released in September 2025, with predictions of higher prices compared to the iPhone 16.

  • Analyst Jong Wook Lee suggests iPhone prices will increase due to previous years' profit margin declines.
  • The current iPhone 16 starts at $799, but the iPhone 17 is expected to cost more.
  • The rumored iPhone 17 Air could have a starting price of around $1,299.
“Although there were initial expectations that Apple’s iPhone prices would rise this year, prices were unusually not increased. As a result, profit margins have declined since...” - Jong Wook Lee

The iPhone 16 currently starts at $799, but consumers may need to prepare for a price hike with the impending iPhone 17 launch.

item.title: 39 Maharashtra Ministers Join Devendra Fadnavis' Cabinet. Full List - NDTV
item.description:
39 Maharashtra Ministers Join Devendra Fadnavis' Cabinet. Full List

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

The much-awaited cabinet expansion of the new Maharashtra government led by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis happened today, with 39 ministers taking oath.

  • A total of 39 ministers inducted into the Maharashtra cabinet.
  • 19 ministers from the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).
  • 9 ministers from the Ajit Pawar-led Nationalist Congress Party (NCP).
  • 11 ministers from the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena.
“This expansion marks a significant step forward for the governance of Maharashtra," said Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.

The cabinet expansion highlights the collaborative efforts between multiple parties to strengthen governance in Maharashtra.

item.title: WPL 2025 Auction: Live updates, player & squad lists - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
WPL 2025 Auction: Live updates, player & squad lists

Updated: 2024-12-15 • Source: ESPNcricinfo

Overview of the WPL 2025 auction highlights significant transactions, including a record sale of uncapped players.

  • Gujarat Giants were most active in the auction.
  • A total of 19 players sold for INR 9.05 crore.
  • Notable big buys included Simran Shaikh (INR 1.90 crore) and Deandra Dottin (INR 1.70 crore).
  • No capped Indian player was sold during the auction.
  • Full lists of players and squads are available on the ESPNcricinfo website.
"We were targeting Deandra Dottin and Simran Shaikh. They bring in power and batting at a high strike rate." - Michael Klinger, Gujarat Giants Coach

In conclusion, the WPL 2025 auction has reshaped the squads with remarkable bids for uncapped players, reflecting a shift in the franchise strategies for the upcoming season.

item.title: Craving Sweets? Try Saumya Tandon's Healthy Sweet Potato Halwa Recipe For A Guilt-Free Indulgence - News18
item.description:
Craving Sweets? Try Saumya Tandon's Healthy Sweet Potato Halwa Recipe For A Guilt-Free Indulgence

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

Saumya Tandon shares her journey of quitting sugar and its substitutes for four years and presents a healthy sweet potato halwa recipe as a guilt-free dessert option.

  • Saumya Tandon is known for her role in "Bhabhi Ji Ghar Par Hai" and adheres to a strict fitness and diet regimen.
  • She eliminated all sugar and its substitutes, focusing only on naturally sweet foods.
  • Tandon describes her experience as a 'game changer' and encourages others to try desserts without sugar.
  • The recipe for sweet potato halwa uses ghee, milk, and optional nuts for flavor and nutrition.
“I gave up sugar /all sugar substitutes, honey and jaggery 4 years ago. I only eat fruits and dry fruits and desserts made of them. It’s a game changer. Try! Will keep posting desserts without using sugar/honey/jaggery and make you all believe we can eat sweet without sugar too.” - Saumya Tandon

This sweet potato halwa recipe presents a healthy alternative for dessert lovers looking for guilt-free indulgence while maintaining their dietary goals.

item.title: WPL 2025 mini auction Live updates: Deandra Dottin joins Gujarat Giants for 1.7 crores - Hindustan Times
item.description:
WPL Auction Highlights: Gujarat break the bank for Simran, Dottin; Sneh Rana goes unsold

Publication Date: December 15, 2024   |   Source: Hindustan Times

The WPL Auction took place in Bengaluru, where significant player purchases were made, including Simran Shaikh and Deandra Dottin by Gujarat Giants for ₹1.9 and ₹1.7 Crores respectively, while veteran Sneh Rana went unsold.

  • Gujarat Giants made the biggest splashes, acquiring Simran Shaikh for ₹1.9 Crores and Deandra Dottin for ₹1.7 Crores.
  • A total of 120 players were up for auction, with only a fraction expected to be sold.
  • Other notable purchases include G Kamalini by Mumbai Indians for ₹1.6 Crores and Prema Rawat by Royal Challengers Bengaluru for ₹1.2 Crores.
  • Several players went unsold including Sneh Rana, highlighting the unpredictability of the auction.
“Simran is the most expensive buy in this auction with GG spending 1.9 Cr on her.”

The auction showcased a mix of high-profile transactions and surprises, with teams aiming to strengthen their squads ahead of the league season.

item.title: Paracetamol poses gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, and renal risks for seniors: Study - The Times of India
item.description:
Paracetamol poses gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, and renal risks for seniors: Study

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Not provided

A new study from the University of Nottingham highlights the potential risks of repeated paracetamol use in individuals aged 65 and older, linking it to serious gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, and renal complications.

  • The study analyzed health records of 180,483 seniors over a 20-year period.
  • Repeated paracetamol usage (≥2 prescriptions within six months) was associated with increased risks of peptic ulcers, heart failure, hypertension, and chronic kidney disease.
  • Paracetamol, traditionally seen as a safe pain reliever, can cause liver toxicity, especially in older adults.
  • The findings were published in the journal Arthritis Care and Research.
"Due to its perceived safety, paracetamol has long been recommended as the first line drug treatment for osteoarthritis by many treatment guidelines, especially in older people who are at higher risk of drug-related complications." - Professor Weiya Zhang

This study raises critical questions about the safety of long-term paracetamol use in older adults, urging a reevaluation of treatment guidelines.

item.title: ‘My political career made, unmade by Gandhis’, says Congress veteran Mani Shankar Aiyar - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘My political career made, unmade by Gandhis’, says Congress veteran Mani Shankar Aiyar

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar has expressed that his political career has been significantly influenced by the Gandhi family, both positively and negatively, and has offered insights on the party's leadership decisions over the years.

  • Aiyar claims his political career was “made and unmade” by the Gandhi family.
  • He stated that he had limited personal interactions with Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, and Priyanka Gandhi.
  • Aiyar believes if Pranab Mukherjee had become Prime Minister in 2012, the Congress would have performed better in the 2014 elections.
  • He recalled feeling surprised when Sonia Gandhi remarked, "I’m not a Christian" during a Christmas greeting.
  • Aiyar's upcoming book 'A Maverick in Politics' discusses these political dynamics and his experiences.
“The irony of my life is that my political career was made by the Gandhis and unmade by the Gandhis.”

In conclusion, Aiyar reflects on his complex relationship with the Gandhi family while emphasizing the pivotal role of Pranab Mukherjee's potential leadership in Congress's political fortunes.

item.description:
Triptii Dimri Avoids Paps As She Gets Spotted With Rumoured BF Sam Merchant, Says ‘Jao Please’ | Watch

Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: News18

Triptii Dimri was recently spotted in the city with her rumoured boyfriend Sam Merchant, making headlines with her request for paparazzi to leave them alone.

  • Triptii Dimri was papped while leaving a restaurant with Sam Merchant.
  • In a video, she asked the paparazzi, “Jao jao please” while posing for the camera.
  • The actress previously attended a concert by Canadian singer Bryan Adams.
  • Triptii is currently filming the romantic drama Dhadak 2, a sequel to the 2018 hit Dhadak.
“Jao jao please,” - Triptii Dimri, requesting paparazzi to leave.

In a busy week for Triptii Dimri, she continues to balance her rising fame with her personal life, as she navigates public interest in her relationship with Sam Merchant and her ongoing film projects.

item.description:
Companies News Today Live Updates on December 15, 2024: ‘Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min’: Bombay Shaving's CEO Shantanu Deshpande raises concern over food delivery market

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: LiveMint

Shantanu Deshpande, the CEO of Bombay Shaving Company, expresses serious concerns regarding the health implications associated with the rapid food delivery market in India, addressing issues like preparation times and overall safety.

  • Deshpande highlights that the quick commerce food delivery process is too rapid — 'Cook time 2 min, delivery time 8 min' — raising alarm over health standards.
“The quick pace of food delivery poses health risks and raises questions about safety,” said Shantanu Deshpande.

This commentary underscores the need for a critical examination of the quick commerce industry and its practices, particularly concerning consumer health and safety.

item.title: How intermittent fasting could lead to hair loss - The Indian Express
item.description:
How intermittent fasting could lead to hair loss

Publication Date: December 13, 2023

Source: Cell Press

Kilos are not the only thing that intermittent fasting will help you shed. A new study shows that the wildly popular weight-loss method could also inhibit hair growth.

  • Intermittent fasting is a time-restricted diet where participants consume calories in an 8-12 hour window.
  • Benefits include weight loss, increased insulin sensitivity, and improved diabetes control.
  • A 2023 survey reported that over 12% of respondents in the US are practicing intermittent fasting.
  • Research linked intermittent fasting to a 91% higher risk of death from cardiovascular disease.
  • Disruptions in sleep cycles and gastric issues are also associated with intermittent fasting.
  • A recent study shows a link between intermittent fasting and hair loss by inhibiting hair follicle regeneration.
“Commonly used intermittent fasting regimens inhibit hair follicle regeneration by selectively inducing apoptosis [programmed cell death] in activated hair follicle stem cells (HFSCs)…”

Researchers found that mice on intermittent fasting exhibited slower hair regeneration, and similar effects were observed in a small human trial, albeit likely less severe in humans.

The study suggests that hair growth inhibition occurs because HFSCs cannot handle the oxidative stress from switching energy sources during fasting.

“During fasting, adipose tissue starts to release free fatty acids...but these stem cells don’t have the right machinery to use them,” - Bing Zhang, senior author and stem cell biologist.

Further research is needed to understand the effects of intermittent fasting on hair loss across different individuals.

item.title: Delhi polls: AAP unveils 38 candidates, Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi| Full list - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi polls: AAP unveils 38 candidates, Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi | Full list

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 03:41 PM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) announced its final list of candidates for the 2025 Delhi Elections, with Arvind Kejriwal running against Sandeep Dikshit from New Delhi.

  • 38 candidates announced for the Delhi assembly elections.
  • Arvind Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi against Sandeep Dikshit.
  • Other notable candidates include Atishi from Kalkaji and Gopal Rai from Babarpur.
  • Eleven candidates were already revealed in the first list, followed by 20 in the second and one in the third.
  • Seventeen current lawmakers have been removed from the party's lists.
  • In the 2020 elections, AAP won 62 out of 70 seats.
"Our party has a solid group of educated individuals to carry out its vision and strategy for the advancement of Delhiites." - Arvind Kejriwal

With the assembly elections approaching, the AAP is positioning itself as a strong contender, emphasizing their achievements in previous terms and their plans for future developments.

item.title: Ajith Kumar ditches his beard in fresh, new look for Good Bad Ugly, fans say he doesn't need digital de-ageing - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ajith Kumar Ditches His Beard in Fresh, New Look for Good Bad Ugly, Fans Say He Doesn't Need Digital De-Ageing

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Ajith Kumar has completed filming for his upcoming film Good Bad Ugly, unveiling a fresh new look that has excited his fans.

  • Ajith shared pictures from the final day of filming showcasing his clean-shaven appearance.
  • Director Adhik Ravichandran highlighted the wrapping up of the shoot on social media.
  • Fans are praising his transformation, reminiscing about his earlier looks from the 90s.
  • The film's details are mostly under wraps, and it is slated for release next year.
  • Music for the film is composed by Devi Sri Prasad and it is produced by Mythri Movie Makers.
“What a Transformation. 90’s #AK Is Back.” – Comment from a fan
“No need de-aging techniques. Looks terrific! AK needs to do a couple of movies in this same look.” – Another fan

The excitement surrounding Ajith Kumar's new look for Good Bad Ugly illustrates his enduring appeal and adaptability as an actor, as fans eagerly await the film's release next year.

item.title: Galaxy S25 series prices leak, Realme Neo7 is official, Week 50 in review - GSMArena.com news - GSMArena.com
item.description:
Galaxy S25 series prices leak, Realme Neo7 is official, Week 50 in review

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: Not specified

As we wrap up week 50 of 2024, key developments include potential pricing for the Galaxy S25 series and the official launch of Realme's Neo7 smartphone.

  • The Galaxy S25 series is expected to maintain the same pricing structure as the S24 series.
  • Upgrades include the Snapdragon 8 Elite processor and up to 12GB of RAM for the smaller model.
  • The S25 Ultra will feature a new 50MP ultra-wide camera while maintaining its main camera from the previous model.
  • Realme introduced the Neo7, equipped with a Dimensity 9300+ chipset and a large 7,000 mAh battery.
  • The Neo7 offers a 50MP main camera and an 8MP ultrawide, with prices starting from CNY 2,199 ($302).
  • Huawei's Mate 70 series highlights 100% domestic chip production in China, showcasing the Kirin 9020 chipset.
"Huawei has achieved 100% domestic production of chips, which is a testament to the true autonomy of the semiconductor industry in China." - Richard Yu, Huawei CEO

In summary, the Galaxy S25 series appears to follow in the footsteps of its predecessor in terms of pricing, while Realme's Neo7 and Huawei's advancements in domestic chip production are notable highlights of the week.

item.title: ‘If you have problems with EVMs…': Omar Abdullah's salvo at INDIA ally Congress - Hindustan Times
item.description:
If you have problems with EVMs…: Omar Abdullah's salvo at INDIA ally Congress

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 04:21 PM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah criticized the Congress party's stance on Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), arguing that they cannot reject EVMs after losses while celebrating wins with the same machines.

  • Abdullah addressed the Congress's doubts about EVMs following defeats in the Haryana and Maharashtra Assembly polls.
  • He stated that one cannot selectively trust EVMs based on election outcomes.
  • Abdullah encouraged parties to remain consistent in their views on voting mechanisms.
  • He defended the Central Vista project, stating it was necessary for a new Parliament building.
  • Reports indicate rising tension between the National Conference (NC) and Congress, particularly after recent elections in Jammu and Kashmir.
"When you get a hundred plus members of Parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that as sort of a victory for your party, you can't then a few months later turn around and say... we don't like these EVMs because now the election results aren't going the way we would like them to." — Omar Abdullah

Abdullah's comments indicate growing friction within the INDIA alliance and highlight the need for party leaders to consistently support their electoral processes. His advocacy for principles over partisan loyalty bolsters his political stance amid rising tensions.
